text.title: Porto, Portugal Travel Guide: Best things to do + eat in 48 hours! ðŸ‡µðŸ‡¹
text.p: just a three hour Journey from Lisbon is
a beautiful city of Porto foro famous
for its port wine and also known as a
city of bridges with six total running
over the Duro River hello everyone my
name is Jalen and I'm a travel and
lifestyle Creator based in New York City
in this video I'll be taking you guys
along our journey through Porto and
sharing everything we ate and saw
we've officially arrived in Porto we
just got off the train it took three
hours I literally slept the entire way
we're at the station right now we just
got dropped off and we're gonna head to
our hotel now we're staying right on
ruas Das Flores also known as Flower
Street in the beautiful hotel called
vignette Casa de company this is a
pedestrian only Street running from the
salbento station all the way to the
drill River this hotel is actually one
of the five most emblematic buildings on
Flower Street built in the 16th century
so this is a room there's a huge vanity
entryway area right here it's so
stunning The Lighting in here
there's like a seating area then it
opens up to the bedroom we have a
king-sized bed I love the mirrors the
gold accents and this is the bathroom
we have the double sink
and this is our closet
I like how everything is super seamless
bathroom is right here and then our
standing shower
we actually don't have a view it's just
to the
Street
so I'm not gonna open that but yeah that
is it for the room tour we freshened up
a little bit and walked straight out of
our hotel onto Flower Street it was
super Lively there were street
performers lots of restaurants with
people eating outside enjoying the
beautiful weather
yeah
we walked around sightseeing and then
ended up at the Duro River
I didn't realize how close in distance
it was but I definitely love how
walkable the city is already
[Music]
we're waiting for Sunset everyone is
here just sitting along the edge there's
restaurants along this strip as well so
tons of dining options with a nice view
there's Bridges right in front of us and
at the opposite side are a ton more
shops and restaurants and it's just such
a pretty scenery
[Music]
thank you
[Music]
after that we headed to a nearby
restaurant that I found on Google also
really popular we had some of their
signature dishes including this garlic
shrimp that was super delicious would
highly recommend it we also got the
mushroom risotto that a lot of people
recommended in the reviews and it
definitely did not disappoint the next
day we started bright and early and
headed straight to salbento station
which is located right up the street
from our hotel and it's covered with 22
000 ceramic tiles filled with the
history of Portugal
and because we were in the area we had
to check out probably the fanciest
McDonald's we've ever been to it had
chandeliers inside and I believe it was
two stories
[Music]
foreign
[Music]
our next stop was this beautiful and
famous bookstore and it said that JK
Rowling frequented this place often when
she taught English here in Porto and was
supposedly a direct inspiration for
Harry Potter you do have to purchase the
ticket in order to get into the
bookstore and the line does get very
long so be mindful of that or you can
get a priority ticket which includes a
purchase of a Romeo and Juliet book
which is what we did and we skipped the
line all together
[Music]
thank you
right across from the bookstore is a
church that you can explore and then we
headed up to a nearby cafe to grab a
quick bite I was desperately in need of
some bananas and fruits in general so I
got a peanut butter banana sandwich and
then Andy got a protein shake
[Music]
thank you
[Music]
it's such a pretty day today we're
sitting outside of the tower there's a
bunch of people out here on laying on
the grass picnicking we spent the whole
day kind of sightseeing and walking
around I didn't realize how walkable
Port I mean I knew how walkable Porsche
was but how close everything was because
initially when I mapped everything on
Google the distance looked pretty far
but everything ended up being like a
5-10 minute walk from the area that
we're staying at and we haven't had to
walk too far the hills aren't as steep
as Lisbon there's not a lot of
stairs that we've come across compared
to Lisbon so it is easier to walk around
and everything is closer in proximity
[Music]
and crispy
[Music]
yeah
[Music]
so earlier we spent the morning
exploring and sightseeing and then we
spent the afternoon getting some work
done Andy also had some meetings to do
and now we're heading to our final
dinner here in Porto we're leaving
tomorrow back to Lisbon on another three
hour Journey train ride
um our dinner is actually on this
pedestrian street right here so super
close
super close by and I cannot wait
um yeah
it's been a really short trip here but
it was super beautiful I really enjoyed
the time here like I said earlier
everything was walking everything was
walkable and just the views here the
streets are very
the neighborhoods are super charming and
it's just the whole Ambiance in general
is really nice so I'm gonna head to
dinner now and then wrap up this video
[Music]
foreign
[Music]
look at the ball
because the hotel is located on a

10 minute drive to the station from our
hotel
[Music]
thank you
all right we just got to the train
station our train was supposed to depart
at 1 30. it's 104 right now and we were
just informed that there is a strike
happening so our train is canceled
um the next train is at 2 30 so we have
about an hour and a half and hopefully
we can get back to Lisbon but the view
from here is so pretty you can kind of
see like the landscape in the distance
and all like the neighborhoods along the
hillside it's so pretty
[Music]
thank you
[Music]
we finally made it on the train after

back in Lisbon a lot later than I
thought but I'm going to close off this
